response_parsed.title: Testing Strategies for Typing Code with Pytest (Python 3.12+)
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an overview of testing strategies using pytest for typing code in Python 3.12+. It focuses on static type checking and dynamic type checking with mypy and type hints, as well as type-related assertions within tests.
key_points: Type Hints and Python's Built-in Type Checking

code_examples.code:
def test_add():
    from mypy_extensions import dynamic_typed
    from your_module import add
    assert dynamic_typed(add)(1, 2) == 3

version_notes: Pytest version 6.2.5 or higher is required for pytest-mypyplugin.
caveats: It's essential to ensure that your codebase follows consistent naming conventions and practices when using type hints.
The dynamic_typed function from pytest-mypyplugin should only be used sparingly, as it may lead to brittle tests.
